snippet: Less than two hours after President Obama left Afghanistan on Wednesday, a large bomb exploded at the gates of the Green Village, a compound used by foreigners.
abstract: Powerful explosions shake Kabul less than two hours after President Obama leaves Afghanistan; suicide attackers strike a private residential compound used by hundreds of foreigners in the east of the city, breaching the outer perimeter and leaving at least eight dead and about 17 wounded. Photo (M)/

byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and SANGAR RAHIMI; Rod Nordland and Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting

lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan -- Less than two hours after President Obama left Afghanistan, powerful explosions shook Kabul on Wednesday when a team of suicide attackers struck a private residential compound used by hundreds of foreigners in the east of the city, breaching the outer perimeter and leaving at least eight dead -- seven Afghans and a guard -- and about 17 wounded, officials said. Around 6:15 a.m., attackers wearing suicide vests drove a car packed with explosives up to the main gate of the compound, called the Green Village. A heavily secured campus of about four acres, hedged by razor-wire-tipped walls, it houses the residences of American military contractors and Defense Department civilian employees as well as some European diplomats, United Nations employees and other foreign workers. It is in a neighborhood of NATO bases and contractor compounds.

headline.main: Hours After Obama's Visit, Suicide Attackers Kill at Least 8 in Afghanistan
